text: 750ml bottle (bb 31 Dec 2020) at home on 26 Dec 2016, present from JohnRMurdoch and shared with JohnRMurdoch and Stuartyboy, whisky, vanilla, malty aroma, amber with a thin off-white head, whisky, vanilla, caramel flavour, viscous.

Bottled (Triple TV Sports Saturday tasting with the gang). Amber colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is peated, some whisky, dried dark fruits, sweet malts and alcohol. Flavour is alcohol, some smoked notes, mild juniper, peated notes as well as some caramel and a bit herbal notes too. Sweetish, but age has mellowed it out.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2017 Brown bottle, 750 ml, collaboration no. 22, bottle 9,759 of 120,000, from and with Philippe Boutin (merci!), savoured on June 23 2016; nose: light whisky, slight iodine, slight peat, sweet gale; mouth: light whisky, slight iodine, slight peat, sweet gale, finale in peat with presence of sweet gale, medium body, below-average carbonation, lightly sweet, thin; overall: interesting

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, collaboration no. 22, bouteille 9 759 de 120 000, de et avec Philippe Boutin, savourée le 13 janvier 2017; nez : léger whisky, très léger iode, très léger tourbe, myrique baumier; bouche : léger whisky, très léger iode, très léger tourbe, myrique baumier, finale en tourbe avec présence de myrique baumier, corps moyen, carbonatation sous la moyenne, légèrement sucrée, mince; en résumé : intéressante
Bottle shared with Mr_H and John R Murdoch a hazy amber brown beer with fruity whisky aroma flavour is sweet fruity with berry notes from sherry casks woody and whisky notes sweet woody finish

750ml bottle from Jenners Loch Lomond. Been in cupboard for 4 years. Chestnut brown, not much head. Strong whiskey aroma. Sweet whiskey flavour. Strong sweet smoked alcohol aftertaste. Not worth the wait.

Bottle at Haket, august 2nd 2016. Amber body with a small head. Aroma of peated whisky, floral hops and malt. Taste is smoked and boozy, whisky notes are clear here, with sweet biscuity malt. Oak, whisky and caramel in finish. Very unique, big.

Sampled from a 0.75l bottle @ RBNG 2014. Super aroma on this one! Loaded with honey sweetness and sticky buttery caramel - in a good way. Smoke with wood and whisky. Really pleasant to smell at this. It has a near clear deep golden looking looks and a sidesticking just off-white head. Lots of flavor also! Well hidden ABV at first but it seeks up a warning tingling thang in the back of the throat in the swallow. Just loaded with honey and heather. Some wood, lots of sticky caramel and some vanilla hints. Loaded with flavor. 15.02.2014

Bottle: Poured a hazy dirty dark beige color ale with a dirty brown color head with OK retention and not much lacing. Aroma of smoky peats notes with singular grainy malt notes. Taste is also a mix of smoky undertones with light peat and wet leather notes is singular. Light Sherry notes were also perceptible with an herbal finish. Body is about average with medium carbonation. Singular beer that I am glad I tried but not sure I would go back to this again.
Bottle. From old notes. Stout brown. Some fruit and spice, but mostly peaty oak. Distinctive berry sweetness. Interesting.

75cl bottle at the Shrewsbury Beer Share, 16th Sep 15, thanks to Mike for this offering. Brown pour with no head worthy of note. Herbal Whisky overall feel to the basic Fraoch Heather Ale, I found it both interesting and different. Although not a huge Whisky drinker the aroma and flavour seemed to suit the 11% ABV, the Sherry casks might have helped to calm any harshness from the Whisky and the mild woody hints just added to the overall enjoyment for me. A very pleasant beer all round.

75cl bottle @ Shrewsbury Beer Share, Sep 15, thanks to Mike. The penultimate bottle of the share. Pours a hazy deep amber with very minimal head. Big sweet whisky doused fruitcake aroma. Rich and boozy but the whisky aging doesnt seem to have much to accentuate from the original Froach.
Bottle. Cloudy orange with no head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt, wood and hops. Full body with a long bitter / woody finish.

Bottle @ Haket courtesy of Jonas (non-RB). Pours hazy dirty yellow with no head worth mentioning. Smell is malty and floral with sweet dark bread, caramel, oatmeal cookies, dark honey, hay, raisins, peat, sherry and whisky alcohol, minerals and lemon peal. Taste is sweet, malty and peaty. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is sweet, tiny bitter, very tiny sour with caramel, dark honey, dried heather, peat, raisins, sherry and whisky alcohol and hints of lemon peal. Nice oxidation and a tasty treat.
Pours dirty brown with a thin white wisp. Aroma is pugnent woody, sherry and light heather. Taste is extremely peaty, wood, slight sherry sweetness with some heather but the peat masks it.

Bottle 5901 of 12,000. Bottled 8/2011, 3 1/2 years old. Poured clean orange-amber with a thin, 1-finger white head that was gone quickly. Aroma is boozy, with notes of wood and dark fruit (maybe raisin or plum). Full body, moderately syrupy with a boozy astringency to the finish. Complex flavor, with notes of wood, buttery leather and dark fruit. The peppery note from the heather in the regular release is pretty much hidden entirely.

Aroma: Sherry, apples, wood, molasses. Appearance: deep orange, cloudy.
Taste much like aroma, with a floral component. Surprisingly balanced considering how sweet it is. Really well done. Truly a pleasurable experience.

This is an odd, but tasty, duck. Pours clear burnt orange with no head or lacing. Nose is peated whiskey and spice. Flavours of peat, flowers, spices lots of sherry. Taste mer sweet med/light bitter. Medium somewhat sticky body with lively carbonation.

2011 vintage bottle. Thanks Joel for the sample!
Aroma: Caramel, dried fruits, whisky and that odd spicy heather. 
Taste: Sweet with caramel, figs, apples, whisky, leather and...heather. 
Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation and slight oily texture. 
The flavours has melded and rounded everything out a bit. Its odd but pretty nice and interesting. Maybe not my thing to start with.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 [6578-20140808] Bottle. Whisky peat burlap aroma. Clear, orange amber body with a quick foamy head. Spiced pepper peat flavour has a long-lasting spiced pepper aftertaste. Medium body has an uncomfortable spice. Average. (6/3/6/3/12) 3.0
(c/o GregClow, w/ him, blankboy, HogTownHarry, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Its re-sealable." "For her pleasure." "I need one of those." "Im re-sealable."

[6940C-20141129] Bottle. Whiskey peat aroma has a lot of heather. Clear, bright orange Amber body with no lasting head. Smoked peaty heather flavour has a hint of jalepeno pepper and caramel. Medium body. Good, strange whisky goodness. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
Overheard: "The heather is doing a lot of the heavy-lifting in the weirdness here."
Bottle at home. Pours clear amber, aroma and taste of sherry, vanilla, whisky, berries, sweet and creamy.

750ml bottle #07622, 2011 vintage.  Clear dark orange amber, sparkling, small off-white head.  Aroma is potent with manuka honey and sherry, background clove.  Body is medium, soft carbonation, pretty smooth.  Taste has lots of straw and wood, touch of tangy tripel character, light peated whisky, earthy, soft bitterness, drinks like a 5% beer.   Sweet, but nowhere near as sweet as the aroma suggested, thankfully.  Very drinkable, lovely woody flavour.  Very good overall.

Bouteille de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Odeur de whiskey et de petits fruits. Apparence: La couleur est orangée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Gout de céréales avec une pointe de fruité et dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #5833)

750ml bottle from LCBO, Toronto, ON. No.: 06132. 11% alc/vol. 
Pours a hazy deep amber colour with a small tanned head which dissipates quickly. Aroma of sherry, whiskey and dark fruits. Taste: sherry, whiskey, dried plums and a bit smokey finish. Moderate carbonation.
Bottle. Pours old gold. No head. Nose/taste of whiskey, oak, florals, sherry, ginger and vanilla. Medium body.
Slightly hazy dark golden. Small off-white head. Aroma of peat, ash, Whiskey and sherry. Peat and fruitiness in taste and aftertaste. Alcohol is evident. Also a hint of burnt print cards.

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours an orange colour with some fine sediment and average-sized white head. Aroma is full of whiskey, some peat, toffee, spice and alcohol. Flavour is big whiskey, peat, wood, some gently sweet toffee and a bit of alcohol heat. Medium body. Mellow carbonation. Interesting.

Where and how:  Tasting, Bottle 750 ml 
Aroma heat, pepper, clove, fairly intense whisky aroma. Late dryness, with touch too heavy dry heat. 
 Appearance : 
Top: white lighter cap.
Base: clear, amber.
Palate :  front dry with softer mid, complex. 
Taste: ash like front, peat smoke, hint of dark soil. 
 other notes  Hmmm. Ale that makes you stop for a second and wonder a bit about its composition.

[Bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o GregClow] Pours a deep gold with a small semi-lasting frothy white head. Aroma of smoke, caramel malt, wood, dark fruit and a touch of alcohol. Flavours the same, smoky, malty and fruity. Alcohol is relatively well hidden. Medium bodied. It almost has a Barley Wine-ish quality to it, either way, its very good.

Bottle... Pours clear and deeply amber with dirty-orange shimmers and really no head. This has the same fantastic bouquet as the base beer  toffee mostly - but with a nice, gentle, smoky component that really makes me want to visit an Islay or Lowland distillery in Scotland. Medium-bodied with prickly carbonation. Finishes tangy and crisp. The former sherry, and then Scotch barrel is utilized to perfection here.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2014 2014-08-08. Crisp golden body with a small white head. 3+ Aroma of peat smoke and moderate woody barrel notes. 3+ Flavour is moderately smokey throughout but it ends up being the dominant character for me. Sweetish pale malt core. Moderate alcohol is largely masked by the smoke for me but is relatively restrained on its own merits. Very smooth medium bodied palate, soft carbonation. Well crafted beer but not to my own taste. Bottle shared by GregClow
"The bottle looks like its... For her pleasure..""OR HIS!!!"

Appearance: Clear copper/amber with no head.
Aroma: Golden syrup, toffee, peat, spiritous,woody, fruity.
Taste: Low/medium sweetness, lo bitter and sourness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture and body, low carbonation, lingering fairly dry toffee, whisky finish
Comments: Gorgeous. Bottle number. 04114

A very rich,sweet and unique beer. Pour is a little flat no head or very little. Aroma is sweet,woody and alcohol. A nice full body beer but to sweet for me. Plate was very nice silky and coated well.

Purchased at LCBO for around $12. I have Never had a beer with such obvious barrel smell to it, smelled great. Taste was great as well, strong tho, I was hurting with a bad hangover the next day. I think this was a top notch beer tho!

Pours a clear rich amber with a white head, and great lacing. Aroma includes notes of scotch, apple, sherry, plum, liquorice, and mash. Tasting notes include a huge scotch kick with lots of apple, caramel, plum, sherry, and liquorice. The palate is smooth, and slick with a boozy and spicy finish. Excellent!!
Gold pour, decent sized head. Anise and char in the aroma. Sugary sweet with black liquorice, honey, char, whisky, smoke. Medium body. Unique for sure. Would like to revisit with some age.
Licorice, beech root, whiskey. Its young, good unti 2021. Some lace on yellow body.
Golden with a white head - Aroma is malt , vanilla , wood and spirits - Good malt body that has sweetness and vanilla - Good sweet finiah with spirits and malt - This was real good

Deep amber pour with a slight white head. Really nice nose to this. Sweet, wheat and whisky. Taste is nice and interesting. Odd finish, like having dryer lint and week old cut grass in my mouth. Other than that, really cool.

Bu en bouteille de 75cl numérotée #7150, une couleur ambrée trouble et aucune mousse, en bouche grosse attaque étonnate sur le Porto avec le côté boisé vanille et ensuite une attaque sur le whisky noble avec une pointe de fumée, intéressante complexe et brillament faites !
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Couleur foncée profonde. Arôme sur le porto, vin rouge. Change beaucoup de la Fraoch originale. Très bon.

15.02.2014. 0,75l Bottle. RBNG-14. Golden colour with white head. Whiskey!!!!! Very nice aroma of scotch malts. Strong and very rich. Sweet with lots of sugar and honey!!!!! I have to say this one is one of a kind! Very good beer. Its strong, rich and have really nice whiskey flavours.

Bottle sample @ RBNG-14. Clear amber body, small white head. Nose is cognac, wood, alcohol, floral heather honey tones, hints of grapes and vanilla. Strange, but nice. Taste is heather honey, whisky, wood, vanilla, burnt toast, hints of cognac and mild straw. Full body, soft carbonation. Highly original and pretty tasty.

Sampled from a bottle during the Grand Tasting at RBNG 14 at Fredrik 3.s Hall. A shiny naked surface on top of a near-clear amber coloured body. Grain and dried fruity aroma, a little vapour of whisky added to it. Taste of brittle caramel and honey sweetness. The whisky touch towards the ending prevents it from getting overly sweet. Full bodied, semi-dry and with a oily palate. Sipper qualities (Fredriksten festning, Halden 15.02.2014).

From a shared bottle at RBNG-14. Pours deep amber with almost no head. Nice whisky and heather aroma with honey and some strange notes too. Sweet, and mild with surprisingly nice whisky flavours. Really nice! (2014-02-15 - Grand Tasting, Fredriksten festning, Halden)

No head. Clear, apricot colored. Floral nose with notes of fortified wine. Sticky mouthfeel, near full body. Taste is like whisky liqueur with yellow fruits. Hearbal tones. Sweet fruity alcoholish finish. [Shared bottle at GrandTasting, RBNG2014]

Sampled at the RBNG-14 Grand Tasting courtesy of gunnar. Misty orange body with a white rim. Whisky barrel notes in abundance in the aroma. Sweet and fruity flavors. Medium to full bodied. Syrupy and sticky.

Shared bottle at RBNG-14. Pours clear deep golden, weak head. Aroma is malty with notes of whisky, also something unpleasant which I can´t decide the nature off. Taste is moderate sweet, noticeable alcohol in the finish.

Clear medium amber body with an infinitesimal head. Boozy sweet aroma with floral notes. Flavours of whisky and flowers, I dont think Ive tasted anything close to this one before! Close to flat carbonation, oily texture and full body. 
[Sample @ RBNG14 Grand Tasting, Fredriksten festning, Halden ]

Sampled at Big Brew Beer Festival (Morristown). Pours a clear dark golden color with a small off white head. Aroma of strong overpowering whiskey, booze, and sweet grain. Taste was syrupy, boozy, oak, whiskey, and sweet caramel.

At RBNG 2014 Halden. Golden color, ok foam. Aromas of whisky, malt. Medium body & high complexity. On the sweet side, but balanced ok. enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. 
Amber colour with low head. Higher alcohols dominate the aroma, followed by heather and grass. Not so sweet mouthfeel given the high ABV. Big on higher alcohols with whiskey notes and peat. Fruity and grassy with notes of heather. Peppery finish. Each to his own I guess.
Bottle. Dark golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is heather, sugar, malt, alcohol, caramel. Flavour is heather, sugar, oak, malt, alcohol, caramel, wood, dried fruits. Nice beer.
Bottle. Clear golden with a tiny white head. Aroma and taste is whisky, alcohol, smoke, caramel. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel, sweet warming finish.

750ml bottle shared at home. Cant recall the provenance, been holding on to it for this festive season since last year... Pours clear amber, no head. Big whisky aromas, plus cherry and sherry. More fruit comes through on the taste, plus alcohol burn. Another sipper. Good.

Bottle, shared at the Boxing Day tasting at TimEs place in Calgary. Burnt orange amber with a thick off white head. Sweet rye whiskey and corn aroma, boozy. Sweet grainy palate with cheap RR Whiskey notes, dry dusty wood in the finish. Quote of the night from brother-in-law Mike: "this is a Ron Burgundy beer". Indeed.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Deep orange amber, tons of whiskey in the nose with Apricots and cherries. Very malty lots brandy and surprisingly tequila shows up. Very peaty but too sweet and boozy to be really enjoyable.
Bottle - Big caramel notes and whiskey with a bit oak. Clear gold with a thin head. Sweet whiskey and light oak notes. Very sweet and a bit to much light whiskey..
Amber. Nice head. Clears the sinuses.cures a number of diseases. Peaty, scotchy, ale. Yum, smack, hmmm

Bottled August 2011 (~2.4 years old), bottle number 05808.
Appearance: The body is clear with an orange hue, the head is short and thin, dissipating quickly into a foamy white coating.
Aroma: The aroma is almost exclusively heavily peated scotch. The oak is very strong, coming off a bit astringent, and the peat is heavy. Boy this is peaty. There are some underlying fruit aromas, but they are hard to discern.
Taste: Oh boy this is odd in a way I didnt expect. Theres a sweetness on the intro, sort of fruity with marmalade coming to mind and a caramel sweetness. The mid-taste builds up the sweet malts while peat and oak overlie it, surprisingly not as out of balance as expected. The finish builds again, increasing the strength with an ashtray finish, perhaps some pear underlying it all. Boy this is not for everyone.
Palate: Medium bodied, very crisp, with mild to no carbonation.
Overall: I picked this up on a whim, but I wish I hadnt. This is not for anyone who disliked peat. This is chock full of it. I dont know what I was expecting when I bought this, but I do not enjoy it.

Appearance: Clear deep golden color with a small off white head.Aroma: Malty and some peat.Palate: Medium + body. A bit sweet and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Malty, fruity, wood, honey and some peat.Overall impression: Not quite my taste, but still a decent ale.Personal stats: Bottle @ Geokkjer

(Bottle) Clear amber brown with little but persistent head. Lovely aroma mixing whisky and malt and raisins. Full bodied, oily and sticky with pleasant medium carbonation that rounds of a perfect mouthfeel. Wonderful complex and rich taste, really quite sweet which carries the high alcohol very well. Raisins and rich malt give the main flavours. These are added to with distinct peaty whisky flavours, caramel, maybe a hint of banana, and some bitterness in the finish. Fantastic beer. (Thanks Mandy and Duncan)

Bottle shared with bro and dad. Aroma is big and peaty. Peat, oak, sweet toffee, and slight port. Pours bright bronze with almost no head. Taste is a little harsh with a dirty islay peat dominating. The sweetness is almost present but not enough. As it warmed, it got better but not great. Overall, Im glad this wasnt a pricey bottle.

Bottle 750ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear deep golden with a with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, alcohol and wood. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm, caramel and woody finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle.Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, grains, some smoke and wood. Flavor is sweet and malty with some berries, caramel, grains and sherry. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle, 75cl. It pours a clear, dark golden to pale amber body and a small, off-white head. Quite malty aroma, some alcohol blending in, as well as a peated touch. Caramel and some dried fruit notes too. Full-bodied and lightly warming with a soft and low carbonation. The flavor has much the same elements, the maltyness dominating. Lasting finish. Sure a nice one, well worth a revisit, even though its not my preferred kind of beer. 131026

750ml bottle [#03213 of 12.000]. Clear amber colour with small, frothy, rapidly fading, white head. Malty aroma has typical whisky BA notes, vanilla, oak, hints of dried banana. Taste is initially moderately sweet malty with a vanilla touch, hints of caramel, toffee, in the finish dry, woody, hints of warming alcohol. Whisky dominated, neither overly complex nor deep.

Robe ambree, tres faible carbo, petit col fin qui sestompe pour laisser place a une fine pellicule.
Les aromes sont puissant, on sent tout de suite le whisky. Je pensais quil serait leger et que cetait plus pour la frime, mais cest tout le contraire. La tourbe est aussi bien marquee, mais on distingue egalement quelques notes fleuries et du caramel.
En bouche cest un regal, bien ronde lattaque est plutot douce et le bois des futs de chene fait son apparition en force. Lalcool est bien present (11% cest pas rien) mais on le sent plus une fois le verre termine !
Je vais remplir ma cave !!!

Amber golden colour, fast dissipating small white head. Aroma of whisky, malts, candy sugar and heather. Sweet malty flavour, caramel, light whisky, light citrus. Sweet finish, malts, sugar, burnt sugar and alcohol. Not so much of a looker, but nice! Wouldnt have guessed they used a Lowlands whisky though.
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBSG II, Gent 2013. Thanks for sharing, Ben!)

10/VIII/13 - 75cl bottle @ RBBSG II, my place - cask 22 - bottle #02963 (2013-742) Thanks to Ben for sharing the bottle!
Clear reddish pale orange beer, no head. Aroma: very sweet, lots of caramel, somechloride, bit of mocha, sweet malts. Mf: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet caramel, bit peated, whisky, islay flavours, sugary, some citrus. Aftertaste: citric, very peated, caramel, sourish touch, sugary. Lovely beer!

Bottled, thanks fiulijn!  Hazy golden/amber, minimal head. Fruity whisky aroma. Sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Fruity with plenty of honey and heather with notes of peat and wood. Warming peppery finish. Nice!

Bottle at omhpers tasting 130817. Clear deep golden beer, small head. Whiskey aroma, vanilla, caramel, malty, fruity, grapes, alcohol, sherry, whisky, vinous, some pear and peach. Malty whiskey flavor, heather, honey notes, earthy, peat, grapes, vinous, roasted, sherry, vanilla, roasted notes, warming alcohol.!

750ml bottle. Poured a bright clear golden color with a two finger white head that fades quickly. Aroma is all oak, floral spice, booze, noted of underlying sweet toffee and bready grain. Taste starts sweet with big toffee and floral spice mid palate, followed by a berry character and finishes with oak, alcohol heat, and a slight peat smoke. Taste lingers in the finish is drying. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

Sampled from bottle @ RBBSG II. Clear light amber color, virtually no head. Aroma is lightly malty, light to moderately sweet. Taste malts, sweetness, lightly alcohol and some liquor. Nicely balanced, quite like it.

Courtesy of Ben. Thx! 75 cl. bottle sampled @ RBBSG II. This bottle has like most inconvenient and hardest to open cork ever.Clear amber / orange with a white head. Nose is fruity whisky, alcohol coming through slightly, flowers, caramel, slightly syrupy, Taste is bitter & sweet caramel, sweet malts, candy sugar, light wood,fruity whisky covering the whole, slight bitter whiskey esters in the back, light bitter herbs, orange peel, toffee, light sherry, Sticky and oily. Very good stuff.

sample in bottle from beer bloggers conference.
dark burnished gold, slight head. sweet malt, heather honey, lots of honeyed whisky, caramel, and some whisky warmth.

4/11/13. 750mL bottle from Proof Bottle Shop awhile back... just now opening. Light amber orange pour with almost no head. Sweet floral aroma with citrus, orange peel, and bits of BA amd scotch. Rich flavor, grainy and sweet with honey, citrus, orange, and a boatload more Scotch than the aroma led on - lightly peaty - very unique. Surprisingly tasty and interesting.

Pours amber gold with a minimal white head. Aroma is a mixture of whiskey barrel and something lemony. Theres a faint whiff of molasses - just faint. Flavor is off the charts! Whiskey, oak, smoke, up front then it just mellows into something almost savory. Talk about complex. There is a syrupy sweetness that runs throughout, but it s almost agave or tequila-like. This is definitely a sipper and more like a liquor.

21st April 2012Bright clear amber beer with a good off white head. Crispy palate, fine carbonation with a sting in the tale. Smooth creamy malt base. Sweet floral notes, a little vanilla and sherry. Mildly tangy/sour whisky. Minerals. Trace of fruits, well buried. Semi dry finish. Interesting! One of those beers that grabs your attention and doesnt let go but also doesnt blow you away. I think perhaps the whisky barrelling was a step too far (pity could not be sherry only)  but its a very good beer!

Bottle: Deep golden, clear, small off-white foamy layer, moderate to distinctive soft vinous and "woody" nose, some citrussy aromas underneath; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, delicate sourish traces underneath, medium to full bodied, smooth MF; sourish-vinous traces in the sweet caramelly-woody finish. Good, good, good...

Many thanks to Chuck for buying and sharing this one!  Poured clear, lighter orange with a short-lived, tight-bubbled white head.  The aroma picked up a whole lot of smoky peat and earthy whiskey notes accented by funky floral character.. some molasses and honey beneath, but it was fairly well repressed by the peat.. I got slight apple and pear skins on the back of the nose.  The flavor opened with sweeter floral notes and golden raisins, with a hefty wash of peaty Scotch following.. Sherry took over on the middle and through the finish.. slick, woody, boozy finish.  Hot on the palate with low carbonation.. way too much barrel for the underlying brew.. this was a tasty, interesting beverage, but it was hard to get at the "beer" part.

Poured to a golden amber body with an off white hesd.  Aroma was heavily auchentoshan scotch.   Peat and caramel.  Lots of sherry notes.  Very much a sherry scotch and very little beer.  I would have liked to see more of the heather shine through.   Medium bodied.  Surprising that it didnt seem like 11%.

Courtesy of Jesper, bottle 03195/12000Golden color; small head. Sweet aroma of vanilla, fudge and whiskey. Good body strength, sweet malt flavor with accents of fudge, nice whiskey touch, some butter and vanilla, sweet oak, moderate alcohol perception, and medium to low bitterness overall.Simplistic; a big bottle could be cloying, but its reasonably drinkable.

#2199 Copper pour with a small tight laced off white head.  Aroma is heavy on scotch quite a bit peaty some light caramels.  Palate is full well coated and lightly creamy a luscious mouth feel.  Flavour begins sweet and complex caramel some light grains and a bit of almost honey on bread then overcome by a wave of scotch lightly peaty less so than the aroma.  Odd mix but still pretty good probably because I love scotch.

Enjoyed via a bottle at Stubby's in Milwaukee. Pours a reddish gold with a medium white/lacy head. Aroma is heavy on scotch and with some peat. Taste is slightly smoked; honey, charred wood and scotch. Aftertaste is woodsy and light with a slow burn.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle # 02229 from Half Time. Pours clear light copper with a white head that left quickly. Aroma is mixed light fruits, sherry and arguably something whisky. Gets smoky as it sits in the glass. Med + body. Starts with fruit and sherry, but smoky whiskey quickly gets in the front. Sort of a dessert of fruit in sherry followed with a whiskey chaser. Thankfully the smoke is not overwhelming. With time the fruit becomes more grape, the sherry sticks around, and the smoke gets smooth.  And there isnt really any heat - even down the gullet. Develops some oaky astringency. Quite nice.

Fra flaskenr. 2932 (av 12000) på Cardinaltreff nov-12: Tydelig aroma av torv,  blæretang, lyng og honning. Behagelig sødme i smaken og godt balansert - mykt for sine 11%, men torvpreget (peated whisky) blir for dominerende. Mer interessant enn en ølnytelse..

750 ml bottle with a very special and resealable plastic cork (never seen that before), Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 11%. Bottle No. 02932 out of 12000 bottles. Clear amber colour, pours very fizzy with a low off-white head that dies instantly. Strong aroma of raisins and peated whisky, hints of fusel alcohols, heather and myrtle.The flavour is medium sweet with distinct notes of peated whisky and oak, notes of raisins and heather again. Low bitterness. The peat becomes a bit too dominant for my taste, but this is still a fine brew, well worth sampling.
Whiskey nose, dark clear amber. Full bodied scotch flavor, sweet, hoppy and slightly malty. In a bottle. A must have.

Bottle. Pours a pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy whisky woody aroma. Sweetish malty spicy woody flavor with weak hints of dark fruit and caramel. Has a sweetish malty woody finish.

Bottle 750ml. [ Bottle # 639/12000 ]. Clear medium to dark amber orange colour with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, flowers, almond, vanilla, alcohol, wood notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, oak, peat - dry oak, cherry - almond, alcohol warm. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20120914]
Poured darker golden color with thin head...smell was oak sherry alcohol and smokiness...taste was smokier than expected.with sweet warming sensation at end

Bottle @ Really Late Summer Tasting Ulfborg, 2012. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Nose is sherry, vanilla, peat, nuts and toffee. Flavor is peat, oak and mild sherry. Sweet with a low carbonation.
Bottle #639, 11% @ FOneFan. Clear amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt and sherries. Flavour is malt, sherries, oak, little vanilla, peat, medium sweet and warming.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, sherry, wood and peat. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. 140912
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, whisky, smoke, ash, malt and hops.

Bottled 0.75L 03283 tasted at Gallows Bird Mary I Coronation Party. Whiskey nose with some raisins. Clear golden color. Pale thin head. Sweetish taste with some hints of raisins and vanilla. Also taste of whiskey. Warming alcohol.
Flöska, tak yespr. Amber colour. Sweet fruity smoky alco aroma. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, fruity and smokey with spice and herbs and alcohol.

Beer-marathon, Sdr. Borup / Randers the 2012th Ready dark golden beer with a white head. Light fruity and spicy aroma of lightly toasted malt and caramel. Sweet taste of malt and caramel and smoky notes

Bottle at yespr.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of smoke, butterscotch and alcohol.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel and dried fruits with notes of peat.
Sweet finish.
light smoked peat whisky aroma,golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice light smoked finish.

clear dark golde,small white head.
boozy aroma, flowery.
flavor is flowery, malty, boozy, berryish.

Bottled. A pale amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and bread, leading to a dry finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.

bottled. golden coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Spice, herbs, some fruits in the aroma. Light alcohol. flaovuor of alcohol, herbs, spice, liqourice. Medcium bodied. Ends on a spiced and somewhat caramelly bitterness.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a clear golden with a tiny white head. Sweet fruity nose with an ashy edge to it. Rich body, lowish carbonaton, sweet fruit and then again these very ashy wooden accents. Ends sweet with a warming alcohol. Pity about the ashes, otherwise fine. 200812

75 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is mild smoked to smoked. Smooth, sweet caramelish and light earthy. Smoked and toasted malty. Sweet and toasted malty finish. Slight strange combo.

Beer-marathon at Sdr. Borup 2012. Great beer, let it rest for a while in you glass, before zipping it. Golden coloured and clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Spicy aroma, herbs, honey, heather, whisky and faint smoke, all well balanced. FLavor starts sweet, strong, honey, pepper. Honey texture and soft to flat carbonation.

Bottle #09418 75cl. A clear copper amber beer with huge head. Nose is intense on fig and prune notes, deep and sweet. Aroma is malty, caramel on wood and dried fruits, round and vanilla kid of finish. Very pleasant and easy drinkable beer, light burnt caramel touch and burnt cherry, light vinous finish, smoked notes at the finish good.

Bottle at the CBC Tune-Up, London. Cheers to Paul for this one. Pours clear gold with a fine, white film of a head. Big sugary nose with golden raisins, fruits, a bit of hard alcohol. Big sweet flavor with honey, lots of ripe fruits, more golden raisins. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Mild warmth in the finish, sugar, fruits, light smoke and barrel. Some lasting whisky barrel character with dried out fruits. I like it.
Fantastic experience. . . Emmidiate smell of sherry. . . . Taste light  smokey. Well rounded and creamy. . . .

75cl, Bottle 3218/12000, new exclusive Scottish brew Anno 2011, with heather and sweet gale, from Bierzwerg Greven, very complex sweet brew, sweet/alcoholic and slightly woody/spicy, heavy, yet balanced, clear, nearly no head, good and original brew, yet expensive!

17 July 2012, bottle. Light gold, clear, no bubbles. Nose is intense: lots of alcohol, raisins, sugary Whisky casks. Thin, slightly syrupy body. Surprisingly earthy, even peaty, considering it is auchentoshan casks. I kind of like this. Peat marries well in this beer. It's sweet enough to handle the peat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at tasting. Thanks to Marc and Brill for this free sample! Clear, golden/amber liquid with minimal off-white head. Looks like whiskey! Aroma is really sweet with notes of honey, caramel, elderflowers, toffee, booze and some oak/wood. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with lots of toffee and elderflower notes. Less sweet than expected. Medium bodied with light carbonation and sticky mouthfeel. Good, but not really my thing.

Bottle at my Pre-CBC Tune-Up Tasting. It pours clear amber, with a thin white lace. The nose is medicinal, floral, whisky, candyfloss, pear, apple, biscuit and spice. The taste is floral, hay, alcohol warmth, residual sweetness, honey, candyfloss, spice, whisky, pear and apple, with a warming finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Lots going on, Im just not sure if the meld together that well. Alcohol presence is pretty obvious. An interesting beer nonetheless.

Bottle at Scopeys CBC Tune-Up. Clear light brown color with no head. The nose is fermenting raisins, port wine, funky fermented brown sugar and light peat. Old tobacco spittoon. The taste is Islay whiskey, sweet funky syrupy pear and golden raisins. Very unique flavor. Plenty of acid, dry woody finish. Overall, an interesting aromatic beer. The Auchentoshan really leaves its mark.

Bottle at home. Golden amber copper pour, thin white head. Nice rich whiskey, cherry, bready malts, quite open alcohol. Sweet caramel malts, subtle herbal hops, vanilla, brandy cream (christmassy!) and a definite but sweet and surprisingly smooth whiskey finish. Provided you like whiskey (I do!), this is fantastic.

Bottle at home. Copper-gold colour, very little head. Aroma is slightly musky, slightly stale bread, touch of berries and whisky sweetness. Such a distinct whisky flavour, with a touch of sherry dryness and an unusual red berry edge. Pretty big but smooth, with a prickly CO2 present on the mouthfeel. Really nice.

Bottle, bought @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours clear amber with a small, frothy, off-white head. Aroma has butterscotch, clear heather, sherry. Werthers Echte. Medium carbonation, fine dry mouthfeel. Flavour has caramel, very soft heather with some dryness. Light vinious. Very elegant whisky.

bottle pours a deep rich gold with temporary white head. aroma is rich  - whisky  , malts , toffee caramel  , oak  , vanilla .  taste  is sweet and rich  , whisky effect is detectable , caramel  , alcohol warmth comes through strongly  . Barley wine style with the whisky barrel infusion  . carbonation is modest making for a smooth experience  . oily texture  .

Bottle traded with Appellation Wines, Thanks! Pours clear amber with a small white head. Nose is very fruity, almost cherry like. Alcohol is obvious but not overpowering. Finish is sweet with an almost yoghurtlike creamyness. Friend insist its a cherry yoghurt. Nicely balanced in the end. Not bad at all.

Smells buttery, sweet and alcoholic, but also perhaps a bit like Skips...? An extremely sweet, apple-sour beer which rapidly changes into a barbecue-flavoured beast with a floral backbone. Rather prickly and light on the tongue.

75cl bottle. Pours golden with incredibly lazy bubbles and a nicely proportioned head. The nose has jammy dodgers and cream. The taste has more of the same. The palate is rich in structure and texture and not a cloying finish, though some alcohol burn. Overall, really good beer.

In bottle, thanks Craig. Pours a golden brown colour with no head. A huge whiskey aroma with alcohol quite present. Honey, sherry and just a little heather. Similar flavours, mildly sweet, with mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Lingering heather honey and warming alcohol. This drinks more like a spirit.

bottle at home ... crisp golden ... thin white head ... soft sweet vanilla ... juicy fruits nose ... big whiskey ... sweet whiskey big alcohol ... light malt tones ... while not bad ... this is too whiskey for a man who doesnt like whiskey
Bottle. Reddy amber with a nice frothy white head. Nice aroma of fruit and peat. Woody whisky flavour merges nicely with the festive sherry berry malt flavour. A compelling beer.

Thanks craftycarl21! Clear reddish amber pour with a thin white bubbly veneer. The aroma is massive port and sherry with huge peat. Mild oxidation. Woody oak and nectar fruit come in to make a subtle appearance as well. The flavor is quite interesting- sweet honey, sherry, port, smokey peat and whiskey, nectar fruit, and wood. Medium to thick body with nearly no carbonation making for a slippery and syrupy finish. Really interesting, but the oxidation turned me off slightly.

Clear, light walnut colored pour, minimal head. Nose is monstrously rife with sherry, port, oaky wood, bread, peat, toffee and caramel, sweet pear and apricot jam; really impressive nose to this one, much like an English barleywine but with some touches of different sweetness. Flavor brings more of that huge sherry/port/barrel presence, slight touches of bready oxidation, and more of that beautiful plum, blackberry, and nectar fruit concoction that really aids this beer a lot. Surprisingly thin in the body, but it also hides the 11% superbly well. Really a damn nice beer.
Fantastic barrel aged beer - heady hit of the whisky and the subtle backbone of Fraoch. Really like this but in 330ml bottles maybe next time?
